title: artic-network/artic-mpxv-illumina-nf
description: Run Illumina MPXV amplicon sequencing bioinformatics

input.title: Input Options
input.description: Parameters for finding and handling input data for analysis.

directory.title: FASTQ
directory.description: FASTQ files to use in the analysis.
directory.help_text: Directory containing the input FASTQ files

primer_scheme_selection.title: Primer Scheme Selection
primer_scheme_selection.description: Reference genome related files and options required for the workflow.

scheme_version.help_text: Version of the primer scheme to use, `yale-mpox/v1.0.0-cladeI` and `yale-mpox/v1.0.0-cladeII` are the same scheme but use separate reference fastas.

custom_scheme.help_text: If you have a custom primer scheme you can enter the details here. This must be the full path to the directory containing your appropriately named scheme bed and fasta files; primer.bed and reference.fasta.

output.title: Output Options
output.description: Parameters for saving and naming workflow outputs.

outdir.description: Directory for output of all workflow results.

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.help_text: Prefix for output files, Sequencing run name is a good choice e.g DDMMYY_MACHINEID_RUN_FLOWCELLID.

store_dir.title: Store directory name
store_dir.description: Where to store initial download of database.
store_dir.help_text: database set selected will be downloaded as part of the workflow and saved in this location, on subsequent runs it will use this as the database.

max_cpus.title: Max CPUs to use for a process
max_cpus.description: Max number of CPUs to use for a process.

max_memory.title: Memory
max_memory.description: Maximum possible amount of memory to use for the workflow. Must be in the format 32.GB

max_time.title: Max time
max_time.description: Max time to run a process before timeout killing it. Must be in the format 12.h

advanced_options.title: Advanced Options
advanced_options.description: Advanced options for configuring processes inside the workflow.
advanced_options.help_text: These advanced options do not need to be changed for typical use, but allow fine tuning of workflows for users who want more control over the workflow.

skip_host_filter.title: Skip host filtering
skip_host_filter.description: Skip host filtering if you are not concerned about human contamination in your dataset.

list_schemes.description: List primer schemes and exit without running analysis.

align_consensus.title: Align consensus sequences to the provided reference.
align_consensus.description: Align consensus sequences to the provided reference. With extremely low coverage sequences this can lead to the execution hanging as the aligner tries its best to match a long sequence of Ns to something, therefore this is off by default.

normalizationTargetDepth.title: Normalisation target depth
normalizationTargetDepth.description: Target depth of coverage to normalize to.

discard_incorrect_primer_pairs.title: Discard incorrect read pairs
discard_incorrect_primer_pairs.description: Discard read pairs that do not have the expected primer pairs, this can lead to coverage gaps in amplicon overlap regions where the fragment size is lower than the overlap so is off by default.

primer_match_threshold.title: Primer fuzzy match window size
primer_match_threshold.description: How far from the start of a read to allow a primer match. This compensates for homology between adaptor / barcode in the reference which may otherwise cause read pairs to be dropped.

varMinFreqThreshold.title: Ambiguous variant frequency threshold
varMinFreqThreshold.description: Frequency threshold to call ambiguous variant

varMinDepth.title: Variant caller minimum depth
varMinDepth.description: Minimum coverage depth to call variant

min_mapq.title: Minimum mapping quality
min_mapq.description: Minimum mapping quality to consider a read for variant calling.

skip_normalize_depth.title: Skip depth normalization
skip_normalize_depth.description: Skip depth normalization, this will make the pipeline slower.

fastqSearchPath.title: FASTQ search path
fastqSearchPath.description: Path to search for FASTQ files.
fastqSearchPath.help_text: Path to search for FASTQ files, this is used to find the FASTQ files in the directory specified in the `directory` parameter.
